## Security Checklist
<!-- For all PRs, please complete this security checklist -->
- [ ] No hardcoded secrets, API keys, passwords, or credentials
- [ ] No private keys, mnemonics, or wallet data
- [ ] Sensitive files are properly gitignored
- [ ] Example/template files use placeholders, not real data
- [ ] Environment variables are used for sensitive configuration
- [ ] No script injection vulnerabilities in workflows (user inputs properly sanitized)
- [ ] Minimal permissions granted to workflows
- [ ] Dependencies reviewed for known vulnerabilities
- [ ] Code reviewed for security issues (SQL injection, XSS, etc.)

## Workflow Security (if applicable)
<!-- For workflow changes, complete this additional checklist -->
- [ ] Workflow uses explicit permissions (not default)
- [ ] User inputs are passed via environment variables, not direct interpolation
- [ ] No use of dangerous triggers (pull_request_target without restrictions)
- [ ] Secrets are accessed appropriately and not logged
- [ ] Third-party actions pinned to specific SHA (not @main or @latest)

- [ ] Linting passes
- [ ] Security scans pass
